Promoter.comment:
The crlp2 promoter appears to be functional under nitrogen limitation conditions and positively regulated by NtrC [Zafar14]. This promoter produces a transcript that is not translated because the ribosome-binding site (RBS) is located upstream of the transcriptional start site. It was suggested that it is a negative regulatory system to inhibit the expression of crl, because this promoter overlaps with another σ70 promoter that produces a transcript with the RBS, therefore producing the protein Crl [Zafar14].

This promoter was identified by microarray and ChIP assays with a mutant σ54 strain and a σ54-overexpressing strain, and by σ54-related promoter element identification [Zhao10].

We assigned a putative transcription start site to this promoter based on the observation that the majority of the σ54-dependent promoters, whose transcription start sites were determined experimentally, present a distance of 11 nucleotides between the transcription start site and the -12 box [Barrios99].

Publication.title: Promoter and regulon analysis of nitrogen assimilation factor, sigma54, reveal alternative strategy for E. coli MG1655 flagellar biosynthesis.
Publication.author: Zhao K
Liu M
Burgess RR

Publication.source: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A 111(4);1557-61
Publication.title: Transcriptional occlusion caused by overlapping promoters.
Publication.author: Zafar MA
Carabetta VJ
Mandel MJ
Silhavy TJ

Evidence-Code.comment: Automated inference. A computer inferred this assertion through one of many possible methods such as sequence similarity, recognized motifs or consensus sequence, etc. When a person made the inference from computational evidence, use EV-COMP-HINF.

Publication.title: Sigma70 promoters in Escherichia coli: specific transcription in dense regions of overlapping promoter-like signals.
Publication.author: Huerta AM
Collado-Vides J

Evidence-Code.comment:
IEP inferred from expression pattern.
The assertion was inferred from a pattern of expression data such as
  • Transcript levels (e.g. Northerns, microarray data)
  • Protein levels (e.g. Western blots)
A person inferred, or reviewed a computer inference of, promoter position relative to the -10 and -35 boxes.

IMP inferred from mutant phenotype.
The assertion was inferred from a mutant phenotype such as
  • Any gene mutation/knockout
  • Overexpression/ectopic expression of wild-type or mutant genes
  • Anti-sense experiments
  • RNA interference experiments
  • Specific protein inhibitors
  • Complementation

Comment: Inferences made from examining mutations or abnormal levels of only the product(s) of the gene of interest are covered by code EV-IMP (compare to code EV-IGI). Use this code for experiments that use antibodies or other specific inhibitors of RNA or protein activity, even though no gene may be mutated (the rationale is that EV-IMP is used where an abnormal situation prevails in a cell or organism).
